item0.name: living
item0.description: A language that is still being used and spoken by people.

item1.name: ancient
item1.description: Any language originating in times that may be referred to as ancient.

item2.name: constructed
item2.description: A language whose phonology, grammar, and vocabulary, instead of having developed naturally, are consciously devised for some purpose, which may include being devised for a work of fiction.

item3.name: extinct
item3.description: A language that no longer is the first language or the second language of anyone.

item4.name: historical
item4.description: Languages that were spoken in a historical period, but that are distinct from their modern form

item5.name: special code
item5.description: These language codes should generally be canonical language tags as defined by BCP 47.
